The Jawaharlal Nehru Centre for Advanced Scientific Research (JNCASR) is a multidisciplinary research institute located in Jakkur, a locality near Bangalore, India. It was established in 1989 by the Department of Science and Technology of the Government of India, to commemorate the birth centenary of Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru, who was the first Prime Minister of independent India.

JNCASR is known for its advanced research in various fields of science and engineering. The institute offers a vibrant academic environment with a focus on research in areas such as materials science, chemical science, physical sciences, engineering sciences, biological sciences, and theoretical sciences.

The Jakkur campus of JNCASR is well-equipped with state-of-the-art facilities and infrastructure to support cutting-edge research. It also provides a conducive environment for collaborative research projects and has partnerships with other research institutions and industries both within India and internationally.

The institute offers various programs including doctoral degrees and postdoctoral fellowships, and it is recognized as a center of excellence by the Government of India. It attracts top-tier researchers and students from across the globe, contributing significantly to the advancement of scientific research and development.
